website_summaries.verdict: Motorola's step-up sequel to the Moto Z2 has great features and solid design, but the competition in this price range is about to get fierce.
pros: The Moto Z2 Force is really thin, with a fast processor and great battery life
It can survive drops without shattering
The new dual rear cameras have some cool features we haven't seen before
cons: It's a really high price for a phone that doesn't do anything terribly new or exciting
The modular accessories are sometimes fun, but generally not worth the hassle
There's also no headphone jack, and it's more splash-resistant than water-resistant

customer_reviews.title: Last pioneer
customer_reviews.text: If at all possible I would've bought a newer phone than this but unfortunately this is the newest "unbreakable" screen phone currently on the market that isn't a full on rugged phone that weighs 6 lbs, I have owned the Turbo 2 and a few of the other moto phones and had issues with the charging ports. This one is USB-c so it seems to do a lot better. The phone is still quick and has everything I need. If you're looking at this phone in 2019 you probably already know that you want it because of the screen or some other specific feature, go ahead and buy it.
customer_reviews.author: C L

customer_reviews.title: phone lasted only 6 months
customer_reviews.text: This is the best Motorola model in the past several years, buying it here however has been a nightmare even with the extended warranty from Asurion. The phone died after 6 months (screen failed). It took me approx 3 hours on the phone, and several emails over 10 days with Asurion to convince them that I purchased the warranty, then that the product had actually failed. Not only can they not get me a replacement phone, I can't even get a refund of my money! Their idea of a full refund is an Amazon gift card...if only my local grocery store took them as cash. Lesson learned, I won't anything that requires an asurion warranty again.
customer_reviews.author: julie singleton

customer_reviews.title: The screen won't shatter but it's a big deal breaker.
customer_reviews.text: It's responsive, the camera is good, it's bare bones Android with no skins, the Moto gestures are nice, the battery life is okay but not great. For the price I don't think there's many options with a snapdragon 835. But all of that comes with one huge deal breaker,... the unbreakable screen. It won't shatter but that's because it's made of a soft plastic that scratches very easily, even a fingernail can scratch it and the top layer can start peeling off over time from normal wear and tear. So imo the shatterproof screen is a big down side and a deal breaker.
customer_reviews.author: Jake T.

customer_reviews.title: Great value for used Moto Z2
customer_reviews.text: I needed an upgrade because of my Moto Droid Turbo no longer holds a full day's charge. I saw the potential for Moto Mods to extend the life of the phones battery life with battery pack mods. I was pleasantly surprised with the speed and usefulness of the Moto Z, especially the convenience of the fingerprint reader. Great value!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Avoid motorola
customer_reviews.text: It's a decent phone it self . The screen is great for not breaking but it gets images burnt in very easy . And Moto(Lenovo) is horrible as a company for updates and keeping it's customer in the know.
customer_reviews.author: james hudson

customer_reviews.title: Screen protector incorrectly applied.
customer_reviews.text: Great phone, but the plastic screen protector was literally glued onto the phone. Took about an hour to remove the screen protector and lots of adhesive residue.
customer_reviews.author: diamond jim

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight super fast phone.
customer_reviews.text: Great phone. The replaceable moto mods are wonderful. I normally have the extra battery on the back, and my main phone battery stays fully charged for days.
customer_reviews.author: Doug Alcoe

customer_reviews.title: Good phone terrible battery
customer_reviews.text: Awesome phone but the battery life on this phone just plain sucks & no I'm not paying for a battery mid that is half the price of the phone hopefully Moto fixes this battery problem.... Love the Z1
customer_reviews.author: Rex Barker Ledon

customer_reviews.title: Great price
customer_reviews.text: My second one. Fast delivery. Everything was I tact nicely. Glad it came with a charger.
customer_reviews.author: Ann Bekelya

customer_reviews.title: Scratches and faded
customer_reviews.text: Has two scratches on screan and back is Really faded was disappointed and shipping was a nightmare.
customer_reviews.author: michael burris

customer_reviews.title: High quality phone for the price.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great phone to buy especially if your a gamer like myself.
customer_reviews.author: Shane Stafford

customer_reviews.title: Trash
customer_reviews.text: The phone is awesome as a whole but the one I received was garbage, but that's the chance you take when you buy a refurbished phone. Most times you get a very good phone but every now and again you get a dud.
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: Constantly "updating"
customer_reviews.text: The phone was in great condition and works great except every day that I've had it so far (about 3) I've had 3-4 system updates a day that I've had to download.
customer_reviews.author: Jordyn

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't even turn on
customer_reviews.text: Just on/off flashing of the charging symbol. But never charges. Could not start it a single time. Reset was no help either.
customer_reviews.author: K fed

customer_reviews.title: Happy customer!
customer_reviews.text: For a used phone. I was very pleased. I've had it almost a month and have been glad with my purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Melton

customer_reviews.title: Moto Z Force 2
customer_reviews.text: Moto z force 2 does not disappoint. Does what I need well.
customer_reviews.author: Slevys95

customer_reviews.title: Moto z2 force Verizon branded.
customer_reviews.text: Item shipped was just as describe. Lite wear from normal everyday use.
customer_reviews.author: Phillip Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: Very good shape as described with a small pixel dead. Otherwise like new.
customer_reviews.author: Jamie Meadows

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I arrive earlier than expected. No problems so far, the description of the phone is adequate.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great phone but...
customer_reviews.text: The product and the deliver were exceptional, unfortunaly the phone was not unlocked. Luckly we could communicated with the seller and get solved, but i would had prefered that he was more expresive about how the unlocking was going and some updates during the waiting. Excellent product none the less
customer_reviews.author: Germán P.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent phone
customer_reviews.text: Put a glass screen protector on it for feel and scratch resistance. Plastic shattershield will scratch easily. Wife has had her z force for 5 or 6 years with no issues yet. This z2 force appears to be just as good in every way. My son and I Have had it for a few weeks now and no major complaints with the phone.
customer_reviews.author: D. Taylor

customer_reviews.title: But for $120 used like new
customer_reviews.text: Great phone. I am sticking with Moto for a while. My g4 was good. This phone is excellent. It's fast. Unfortunately, I got it wet. Cameras are jacked, and the sim card and sd card aren't working. But for $120 used like new, it was a steal!! The battery life isnt great. The screen it not as bright as my s7. And it won't win any beauty contests
customer_reviews.author: Greg

customer_reviews.title: Shhhh.... I feel like I am stealing!
customer_reviews.text: Are you kidding me@? Used-gadgets is where I bought it from. 1. Arrived in 3 days 2. Phone is flawless. No scratches. Nothing! 3. Works perfect! 4. Paid $300 for last year flagship with 835 processor! 5. Just happy as can be! Even running Android 8.0. Super kudos for store called USED-GADGETS
customer_reviews.author: Brian T. Clem

customer_reviews.title: Shatter proof scream, great battery super FAST
customer_reviews.text: Motorola phones are generally very durable and reliable, the Z2 is one tough phone and is incredibly feature rich. GREAT Battery and shatter PROOF screen, although it easily scratches
customer_reviews.author: William Clune

customer_reviews.title: Works as expected
customer_reviews.text: Great replacement for my dead Z2. Google search engine is crashing. Other than that, I am happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Boats Woods

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: I really like this phone a lot. It's light, the add ons you can get for it are great, it's super durable, all around a great phone.
customer_reviews.author: Peach

customer_reviews.title: I returned the phone because it was described as new ...
customer_reviews.text: I returned the phone because it was described as new but something about the screen didn't seem new. It had a wave in it that was noticeable in reflections.
customer_reviews.author: yoyoma

customer_reviews.title: I liked the way the phone worked
customer_reviews.text: I got this phone on insurance from at&t. I liked the way the phone worked. It was fast, it had a nice display, and it had a nice camera but I returned it because it did not have WiFi calling and for me that was a big disadvantage. So if you depend on WiFi calling I would not get this phone but if you don't care if it has it or not it is a nice phone. It has a shorter battery life than most phones but you can get the moto mods for that. Also it doesn't have a headphone jack but they send you an adapter so you can still plug head phones in.
customer_reviews.author: Rod

customer_reviews.title: Vendor locked phone is full of bloatware
customer_reviews.text: Beware that non-unlocked phone is pre-filled with all sort of bloatware that tries to subscribe you to something. Also, AT&T version doesn't come with android updates, the last update was from Aug 2017. My older Moto Z has Android 8 and updates are coming regularly
customer_reviews.author: Eugene

customer_reviews.title: Burned in images on screen , weak speaker
customer_reviews.text: I love this phone , but after a year the screen starts getting burned in images and colors. The speaker is really really weak , but I got the JBL speakers mod and that great. That said, everything else about this phone is great. I'm probably going to get another one.
customer_reviews.author: timprater

customer_reviews.title: 6GB of RAM NOT 4GB.
customer_reviews.text: Probably one of the best phones you could have bought at the time it was released, shatterproof screen, snapdragon 835 processor, 6gb of RAM do not listen to the description, it's 6gb of RAM not 4gb. The best part is using the one button nav in the fingerprint sensor. This phone works for all mods including the Motorola 5G Moto mod.
customer_reviews.author: Gino Minosky

customer_reviews.title: Great phone
customer_reviews.text: Put a screen protector on before you use and you're good to go as the screen can't shatter but it scratches easier. Excellent phone!
customer_reviews.author: Brendon Rose

customer_reviews.title: The WIFI on this thing is HORRIBLY slow. But the biggest problem is I (and ...
customer_reviews.text: I DID NOT BUY MINE FROM AMAZON, this review has nothing to do with Amazon. Ignore the mods, you cant use them if you have any protective case on your phone. The WIFI on this thing is HORRIBLY slow. But the biggest problem is I (and many others from what I've found) have to restart my phone every time I want to charge it. It simply wont recognize there is anything plugged into it. Glitches and gimmicks= garbage. Should have stayed with Samsung galaxy. I will be returning to a Galaxy phone as soon as I can.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer
